posts.title: Les gens du Monde
posts.excerpt: While newspapers have to face the important challenges caused by the raise of blogs, tweets and other Internet revolutions, this film offers an insider look at the work of the journalists from the political department of the French newspaper “The World” during the French presidential campaign of 2012. posts.title: North Korea World Cup 1966
posts.excerpt: Eusebio scores four goals to help Portugal come back from 3-0 down to defeat underdogs North Korea 5-3 at Everton’s Goodison Park in the 1966 World Cup quarter-finals. The football legend has died at the age of 71. Widely considered one of the best players of all-time, he scored 733 times in 745 professional matches …

posts._title: Aleksandr Sokurov – Odinokiy golos cheloveka aka The Lonely Voice Of Man (1987)
posts.title: Odinokiy golos cheloveka
posts.excerpt: Made in 1977, and only finally released in 1987, this is Sokurov’s first feature-length film. Extraordinarily beautiful, utilising an array of unusual stylistic devices, it seems as if Sokurov’s style was fully formed from the outset. A sublime meditation on love, loneliness, life and death, it still stands as one of his finest achievements.

posts._title: Hsiao-hsien Hou – Nanguo Zaijan, Nanguo AKA Goodbye South, Goodbye (1996)
posts.title: Nanguo Zaijan, Nanguo
posts.excerpt: After spending much of the decade making films about Taiwan’s complex and troubled history, Hou Hsiao Hsien turns his attention to its money-obsessed present with this gangster drama.
